summary: The Maternal and Infant Syphilis Prevention Act aims to address the rising rates of syphilis, particularly congenital syphilis. The bill mandates the Secretary of Health and Human Services to issue guidance on best practices for State Medicaid and CHIP programs, Indian Health Service, and Urban Indian organizations focusing on improved screening, treatment, and education related to syphilis among pregnant women and infants. It also calls for a report to Congress analyzing the implementation of these practices.
